paragraph.paragraph: The References folder ( ../../../../images/icons/references.ico ), located directly underneath an EiffelEnvision ../project.xml Project node in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htm Solution Explorer , is used to manage the component references used with your project.

EiffelEnvision supports four types of references:
Assembly
Project
COM
Static Assembly

Assembly
These types of component references are those that have been written using any one of the plethora of languages that target and compile for .NET. These types of component references are the most common in .NET and will be added from the .NET tab of the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vbcon/html/vbtskAddingRemovingReferences.htm Adding References dialog box.
Assembly references are represented by the ../../../../images/icons/assembly.ico icon.

Project
In a solution with multiple projects, you can create references to objects authored in another project that resides in the same solution. This creates an interdependency that requires special consideration when building and running the application. For more information, see ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconbuildconfigurations.htm
Build Configurations .
Note: EiffelEnvision projects should not reference other EiffelEnvision projects in this way. EiffelEnvision projects permit the use of multiple inheritance and generics, which is not natively supported in the .NET framework. For more information please see the section on ../../configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xml Precompiled Libraries
Project references are represented by the ../../../../images/icons/assembly.ico icon.

For information on adding and removing project references, see ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskaddingremovingprojectreferences.htm Adding and Removing Project References .

COM
When referenced from the Component References dialog, through the COM page, an interop ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/cpguide/html/cpconcomcallablewrapper.htm COM Callable Wrapper (CCW) assembly will be created in the projects obj directory, and added to the list project references. No all COM references will have a CCW generated for them as vendors may provide a ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/cpguide/html/cpconprimaryinteropassemblies.htm Primary Interop Assembly (PIA), which will be referenced directly from the project. If a wrapper_key_file_name ../../configuring/project_configuration/general.xml Wrapper Key File Name is specified, using the ../../configuring/project_configuration/general.xml General Property Page , the interop assembly will be signed with the specified private key file. COM references are represented by the ../../../../images/icons/assembly.ico icon.

Static Assembly
Static assembly references are assembly references that are added automatically by the Eiffel for .NET compiler. EiffelEnvision shows them under the References folder to indicate that they will be referenced by the assembly compiled by the Eiffel for .NET compiler. Static assembly references are entirely controlled by EiffelEnvision and it will add and remove them as you change your project's configuration.
Static assembly references are represented by the ../../../../images/icons/assembly_static.ico icon.
